roleset.name: to earn, score
roleset.note: CHALK_UP-V NOTES: Based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from chalk.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [Mr. Thomson]*-1 played outfield and third base until 1960 , [*-1]posting a lifetime .270 batting average and chalking up 264 home runs before [*-2] retiring and going into paper-goods sales .
example.arg: before [*-2] retiring and going into paper-goods sales

example.name: passive
example.text: `` We got calls from big block houses asking us if we want [*-2] to make bids on anything , '' said [*T*-1]Mr. Weisman , who , [*-4] happy with his returns on [investments] -1 chalked *trace*-1 up earlier , [*T*-3] declined the offers .

roleset.name: attribute, give credit, name as the cause
roleset.note: CHALK_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from chalk.02-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: *PRO* Chalk that up to reporters not having a clue how a constitutional amendment works .
example.arg: to repoters not having a clue how a consitutional amendment works
